sentence1: and if a man wanted his rights, there was nothing left for him to do but to travel to Copenhagen.
sentence2: This is what Blessom had done, and what his son did after him, for he, too, carried on a law-suit.

sentence1: This is what Blessom had done, and what his son did after him, for he, too, carried on a law-suit.
sentence2: Now it chanced that on Christmas Eve John had had speech with the gentleman in authority, and had attended to his business, and was going along the street in a low-spirited manner, for he was homesick.

sentence1: Now it chanced that on Christmas Eve John had had speech with the gentleman in authority, and had attended to his business, and was going along the street in a low-spirited manner, for he was homesick.
sentence2: And as he went along, a man from Vaage, in a white blouse, with a knapsack, and buttons as big as silver dollars, passed him.

sentence1: And as he went along, a man from Vaage, in a white blouse, with a knapsack, and buttons as big as silver dollars, passed him.
sentence2: It seemed to Blessom that he must know him;

sentence1: It seemed to Blessom that he must know him;

sentence2: "You are walking very fast," said John.

sentence1: "Yes, but then I'm in a hurry," answered the man.
sentence2: "I only wish that I could get there!"

sentence2: "You can stand on the runner of my sledge," said the man, "for I have a horse that covers a mile in twelve steps."

sentence1: "You can stand on the runner of my sledge," said the man, "for I have a horse that covers a mile in twelve steps."
sentence2: So they set out, and Blessom had all that he could do to hold fast to the runner of the sledge;

sentence2: for they went through weather and wind, and he could see neither heaven nor earth.

sentence1: for they went through weather and wind, and he could see neither heaven nor earth.
sentence2: He could not tell exactly where it was, but when they began to hurry on again, he thought that he spied a skull on a pole.

sentence1: He could not tell exactly where it was, but when they began to hurry on again, he thought that he spied a skull on a pole.
sentence2: After they had gone on a while, John Blessom began to freeze.

sentence1: After they had gone on a while, John Blessom began to freeze.
sentence2: "Alas, I forgot one of my gloves where we stopped, and now my hand is freezing!"

sentence2: "Well, Blessom, you'll have to make the best of it," said the man.

sentence1: "Well, Blessom, you'll have to make the best of it," said the man.
sentence2: When they crossed the Finnebridge, the man stopped and set John down.

sentence1: When they crossed the Finnebridge, the man stopped and set John down.
sentence2: "Now you are not far from home," said he, "but you must promise me that you will not look around, when you hear a roaring and notice a flare of light."

sentence1: "Now you are not far from home," said he, "but you must promise me that you will not look around, when you hear a roaring and notice a flare of light."
sentence2: John promised, and thanked him for the quick journey.

sentence1: John promised, and thanked him for the quick journey.
sentence2: The man drove off on his way, and John crossed the hill to his home.

sentence1: The man drove off on his way, and John crossed the hill to his home.
sentence2: As he went he heard a roaring in the Jutulsberg, and the path before him suddenly grew so bright that one could have picked a needle from the ground.

sentence1: As he went he heard a roaring in the Jutulsberg, and the path before him suddenly grew so bright that one could have picked a needle from the ground.
sentence2: And he forgot what he had promised, and turned his head to see what was happening.

sentence1: And he forgot what he had promised, and turned his head to see what was happening.
sentence2: In the midst of it all stood the giant, and he was the man with whom he had driven.

sentence1: In the midst of it all stood the giant, and he was the man with whom he had driven.
sentence2: But from that time forward John's head was twisted, and so it remained as long as he lived.
